title: U.S. stock futures advance after losing stretch
text:
* Futures on the Dow Jones Industrial Average YM00 rose 253 points, or 0.8%, to 33141.

* S&P 500 futures ES00 gained 45.5 points, or 1.1%, to 4153.

* Nasdaq-100 NQ00 futures advanced 185.5 points, or 1.5%, to 12737.

Stocks fell sharply Friday, dragging major indexes to weekly losses. The Dow DJIA fell 0.9% last week, while the S&P 500 SPX dropped 1.2% and the Nasdaq Composite COMP shed 1%.

What's driving markets

Analysts are assessing whether stocks have dropped enough given the Fed's desire to stamp out inflation by lifting interest rates. Key inflation data is set for release on Friday.

"They'd need some clear evidence that inflation is slowing down before they would consider slowing the pace of rate hikes. That keeps the focus squarely on the CPI," said Marshall Gittler, head of investment research at BDSwiss Holding.

"When the economy looks strong — market worries shift to inflation and the risk of higher interest rates. When the data are weaker — the opposite happens. The result? Volatility," added analysts at RockCreek, a Washington, D.C. investment firm.

See: A 'pinch' for the stock market but good news for the Fed: What investors need to know about a strong U.S. dollar

Markets also were paying attention to signs the White House is loosening its stance on tariffs. U.S. Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo said household goods and bicycles "may make sense" as products to ease levies. Solar companies including SunRun Inc. RUN rose after The Wall Street Journal reported there won't be any new tariffs on solar imports for two years.

Need to Know: Don't get fooled by another 'rip' says this strategist who advises watching this 'battleground' S&P 500 level

Companies in focus

* The largest U.S. company by market capitalization, Apple Inc. AAPL, will be in the spotlight as it holds a developers conference in which it's expected to unveil new products. Apple shares rose 1.4% in premarket action.

* JetBlue Airways Corp. JBLU boosted its offer for Spirit Airlines Inc. SAVE on Monday in the latest move in the three-way battle for the discount airline. Spirit has been trying to fight off the JetBlue bid so it can go ahead with an earlier plan to merge with Frontier Group Holdings Inc. ULCC and has said it fears a JetBlue deal would be blocked by regulators. Spirit shares rose 5.8%, while JetBlue shares were up 2.7% and Frontier shares gained 1.1%.

* Amazon.com Inc.'s AMZN 20-for-1 stock split has taken effect. The stock closed Friday at a pre-split adjusted $2,447, and was trading up 0.7% in premarket trading Monday, to put it on track to open just above $123. The last time the stock traded below the four-digit level pre-split was October 2017. The split is Amazon's first in 23 years.

* Shares of UnderArmour Inc. UA were down 0.8% in premarket trading, after S&P Dow Jones Indices said it was booting the athletic apparel and gear maker from the S&P 500. The company and IPG Photonics Corp. IPGP are moving down from the large-cap benchmark to the S&P MidCap 400, S&P Dow Jones Indices said late Friday. Shares of Keurig Dr Pepper Inc. KDP rallied 8.1% and ON Semiconductor Corp. ON climbed 7.2%, as the companies will replace Under Armour and IPG Photonics in the S&P 500.

What other assets are doing

* The yield on the 10-year Treasury note BX:TMUBMUSD10Y was little changed at 2.954%. Yields and debt prices move opposite each other.

* The ICE U.S. Dollar Index DXY, a measure of the currency against a basket of six major rivals, was off 0.2%.

* Oil futures were flat, with the U.S. benchmark CL.1 trading near 118.90 a barrel after ending Friday at a nearly three-month high.

* Gold futures GC00 edged up 0.4% to trade above $1,858 an ounce.

* Bitcoin BTCUSD rose 4.8% to trade above $31,350.

* The Stoxx Europe 600 XX:SXXP rose 1%, while London's FTSE 100 UK:UKX advanced 1.3%.

* The Shanghai Composite CN:SHCOMP ended 1.3% higher on Monday, while the Hang Seng Index HK:HSI advanced 2.7% in Hong Kong and Japan's Nikkei 225 JP:NIK gained 0.6%.
